events.event_name: Release of January 2026 ISM Services PMI
events.description: The Institute for Supply Management released the Services PMI data for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The US ISM Services PMI was 53.8 in January 2026, matching the revised December figure.

evidences.evidence_text: The ISM Services PMI for the US steadied at 53.8 in January 2026, the same as a downwardly revised 53.8 in December

facts.fact_text: The business activity/production index rose to 57.4 from 55.2.

evidences.evidence_text: a faster increase seen for business activity/production (57.4 vs 55.2)

facts.fact_text: The price pressures index increased to 66.6 in January.
Employment and new orders indices slowed compared to the previous month.

evidences.evidence_text: while new orders (53.1 vs 56.5), employment (50.3 vs 51.7) and supplier deliveries (54.2 vs 51.8) slowed.

claims.claim_text: The services sector is undergoing a robust expansion.

evidences.evidence_text: The reading pointed to another robust expansion in the services sector

claims.claim_text: Tariff impacts and geopolitical tensions are contributing to respondent uncertainty.
claims.author: Steve Miller

evidences.evidence_text: There was more respondent commentary in January on tariff impacts and uncertainty, potentially the result of annual contract renewals and geopolitical tensions.

claims.claim_text: Future pricing trends need to be monitored to see if increases will persist.
claims.author: Steve Miller

evidences.evidence_text: whether pricing increases will stick or expand needs to be closely watched

evidence.evidence_text: The reading pointed to another robust expansion in the services sector
There was more respondent commentary in January on tariff impacts and uncertainty
employment (50.3 vs 51.7) and supplier deliveries (54.2 vs 51.8) slowed.
